results.title: Chemical bonding
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway, Davidson Films and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Explains chemical bonding in terms of electric interactions that cause the bonding in the hydrogen molecule. The release of energy when H atoms combine to form H2 on a platinum surface is shown. This energy change is related to the similtaneous attraction of electrons by two or more nuclei, opposed by electron-electron repulsions. Through animation the quantum mechanical view of electron distribution is portrayed. The bonding interaction between two hydrogen atoms is contrasted to the very weak, non-bonding interaction between two melium atoms. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway, Davidson Films and National Science Foundation

results.title: High temperature research
results.creator_credit: David W. Ridgway, Arthur Campbell and Centron Production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
The procedures for producing and measuring temperatures in the region of 2000 degrees are shown. Also studies the bond strength of gaseous titanium monosulphide and shows how its gaseous molecules as well as gaseous titanium and sulphur atoms are produced by the vaporisation of the high melting crystalline titanium monosulphide at this temperature.

results.title: Acid base indicators
results.creator_credit: David W. Ridgway, University of California, Los Angeles and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Proton donor-acceptor theory is used to interpret the experimental behaviour of acid-base indicators. Experiments and animation show the effects on indicators of changing acidity. Equilibrium constants of four indicators are determined and the indicators arranged in order of decreasing acid strength. The competition among bases for protons is shown by mixing the indicators and showing that each changes colour at different total acidity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David W. Ridgway, University of California, Los Angeles and Wexler Film Productions

The competition among bases for protons is shown by mixing the indicators and showing that each changes colour at different total acidity.

results.title: Gas pressure and molecular collisions
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Chemistry Educational Materials Study and Educational Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Explores the relationship between gaseous pressure and molecular collisions. Studies the effects of varying the number of molecules per unit of volume and of varying the temperature. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Inert(?) gas compounds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
The first synthesis of krypton difluoride is traced from its inspiration to the first tentative success. Krypton difluoride is prepared by photolysis of fluorine in solid krypton at the temperature of liquid hydrogen and identified by its infrared spectrum.

results.title: Shapes and polarities of molecules
results.creator_credit: National Science Foundation and Norman Wright Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Observations of electrical effects lead to the concept of molecular polarity. Covalent substances give two types of results: some show marked interactions with electric charges, others give little effect. A model is developed based on polar and non-polar molecules. The molecular dipole model is extended to explain differences in solubility, conductivity and chemical reactivity.

results.title: Industrial weight lifter
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct method of lifting heavy objects. A flexible model simulating the human backbone is used to illustrate how discs are “pinched” when weights are lifted while the backbone is curved. Good posture, positioning, and smooth application of lifting power are shown. Demonstrations point out that using the powerful leg muscles with the back straight and vertical increases lifting power. Extremely heavy items can only be handled with a special lifting device.

Extremely heavy items can only be handled with a special lifting device.

results.title: Indonesian development action
results.creator_credit: Ian Harris and Australian Development Assistance Bureau
results.brief_description: Australian assistance to Indonesia includes research into agriculture and food production, and engineering works such as road building. Australia also provides training for these ventures, which ensures that Indonesia has her own qualified workers. Narrated by Clive Robertson.

results.title: Indian fantasy
results.brief_description: Intended as one episode in a full length animated and colour feature cartoon of Jules Verne’s “Round the World in Eighty Days”, this sequence shows the beginning and end of the journey and the adventures of Phileas Fogg and his servant in India. The film was commenced in 1938 but was not completed.
